reviewText: Wonder wonderful presentation.  The Love Bug has nothing to do with this presentation about walking with the Lord of Love.  Dean Jones does an absolutely moving and powerful job.  You believe you're back in that cave on Patmos with John as he relives his days with Jesus.  It gives insight to much of the early church, and, most importantly for me, that John was a simple man, an imperfect man, yet one greatly used by God.  One of the most powerful messages in this was that God can use you, too, and just like he did John.
summary: I Spent Time WIth Jesus Again

reviewText: This is my second purchase of this movie:  the other I loan out!  I truly never expected to see what I saw; or to experience what I experienced when I purchased this movie!  Dean Jones gives an exquisite portrayl of St. John.  With no other actors involved--but single-handedly he portrays St. John in every phase of his life AND tells the experience of being with Jesus and his own reaction to being in His Presence.  His portrayal is more powerful than I ever imagined one man could portray.  I do not cry easily, but was sobbing by the end of this movie.  I hope every precious soul can experience this one.  In seeing the part at the end that introduces Dean Jones and his wife, I was not surprised to find they were truly in love with Jesus!

reviewText: I have strayed away from the Lord by self-pity and depression. After watching this movie (and I too, was expecting a Hollywoodized movie and was so happy that it isn't) I was felt revived by Dean Jone's performance. He was "right on cue" and one would believe that Dean Jones, himself is a born-again Christian. The Holy Spirit just flowed out from his lips!!!This film/play is for the whole family. Show it in church. This is one DVD that will enrich your life and give it increased meaning. In short, you yourself will feel the Holy Spirit's presence.Be blessed. Get the DVD and share it with others and have others blessed also.
summary: Revived by the Spirit of the Lord

reviewText: Was not sure if I would like this because of it being only one person doing the whole show.  I was very surprised because Dean Jones did an excellent job in telling John's story and the story of Christ.  He did several voices and made you laugh and cry.  I definitely recommend this to anyone who loves live stage performances and is interested in finding out more about Christ. reviewText: I have bought at least a dozen copies of these as gifts for friends and family. Years ago, I was a big fan of Dean Jones as a movie heartthrob in comedies, but he has grown into a mature and compelling dramatic actor and this story of the last days of John the Apostle as narrated by himself is powerful, inspiring and uplifting. And I'll bet you didn't know that St. John could dance!

reviewText: Dean Jones' performance of this one act play is a tour de force of the craft of acting.The fact that the performance and the story is a bringing alive of the last home of St John, who wrote the Gospel of John, three letters in the New Testament and the Revelation, makes this one of the greatest tools to tell the whole Gospel in such a way that even those who do not know it will be fascinated, entertained and educated. Used as a teaching tool, this DVD can make the most boring of Sunday School lessons something to look forward to.
summary: One Act, One Actor, One Great Performance

reviewText: ST. JOHN IN EXILE is not to be missed. It's a one man show starring Dean Jones who gave the performance of his life.St. John was one of the youngest of the Twelve Apostles. He was also the last to die. This film shows St. John while he was imprisoned. He relates the story of Jesus with love, pathos and wit.Jones very cleverly uses many voices in his dialogue. The voice of Jesus is clear and beautiful. St. John's voice is a little rusty like that of an older man, but his dialogue is joyful and filled with life.  He shares many of the Christian Bible stories and his change of voice and atmosphere are amazing to see and hear. This film is well worth seeing and I highly recommend it!
Title: N/A

reviewText: We always think of the apostle John as the "disciple that Jesus loved" and as a young man.  Dean Jones in St. John in Exile, gives him new life and humor.  His John uses his vaptivity as a tool for Evangelism and converting.  You believe he knows the people that he refers to, and you feel his connection to them.  He shows the faith of John as alive and vital.  A treat for viewers.

reviewText: The movie is highly recommended for theatrical audience. This movie is not Recommended for those seeking to learn about John's testimony about the book of Revelation. This solo play is best given to a Pastor who is teaching the book of John. Not recommended for family viewing more for worship leaders or Pastors. The words used in not a verbatim of the Gospel of John. The actor is a Disney Actor but the narration is not suitable for children. It would be deemed boring. Act 2 is better than Act 1 is more interactive and alive. It does have some humor in the dialogue. The best learning in this play is how John lived to be better not bitter despite the narrative of violent deaths of the Christians. This is a rare play that also talks about the freedom of the Christians from Roman persecution and how John was able to hear the goodnews that he can go back to Ephesus where he was buried. I highly recommend reading the Extra and testimony before appreciating the play. This is one play that is worth donating for a church library. Expect to know about Jesus life. Expect to learn about Peter and learn to stay faithful like John. Again this is for a highly informed .christian audience who have read the Gospels and appreciate plays. For those who like movies this DVD is not for you. The picture in the cover is what you get. It's the acting that is the core of this movie.
summary: Excellent Testimony to the Gospel of John

reviewText: In a tour-deforce, 92-minute, one-man stage production starring Dean Jones and which was recorded in full color on video and presented to the Christian community by Bridgestone Multimedia, St. John in Exile is the extended monologue by John as he was held captive by the Romans. The last surviving member of Jesus' twelve disciples, John remembers and relives the profound events of Jesus Christ's life which forever changed human history. A powerfully enacted, masterfully written, and utterly unforgettable presentation, St. John In Exile is a superbly produced and highly recommended addition to family, church school, seminary, and ecclesiastical studies video collections.
summary: Relives the profound events of Jesus Christ's life

reviewText: I know what you're thinking, "herbie the love bug," right? Well, here Dean Jones is spectacular. When I first bought this, I was expecting a movie based on the last days of the Apostle John and the making of the book of Revelation. What I got instead was much better.This film is a one man play where DJ takes on the role of the apostles and Jesus and re-enacts John's exile. In this play, DJ starts with the Apostle's work to bring Christianity to the workers at the island and then recounts the life of Jesus through the Apostles' eyes  that lead to this moment.There are times when you will cry with DJ, there are times where you will laugh, there are times you will exult with him in our Lord. I have rarely been as impressed with a one man performance as I was with this one.The music and production are a bit low quality, but you don't even notice it anymore after the first few minutes. And when you're done with this film, you'll be doing a standing ovation just like the original audience!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an outstanding production. For those who only know Dean Jones from the Disney pictures (The Love Bug, Shaggy D.A., etc.) and such, here is a role for the actor that provides an opportunity for him to reveal both his tremendous dramatic talent and his deep Christian faith. Although some may say it is a little slow moving (perhaps because it is a recording of a stage performance at Jack Hayford's Church on the Way), the story is excellently written and has real depth. The production makes good use of various camera angles as well as creative lighting to add drama to the presentation. You find yourself quickly drawn into the story as Jones powerfully brings St. John to life, recounting, from his cell on the isle of Patmos, his journey with Jesus and the other disciples. A real tour de force performance by Jones (in the tradition of such one-man shows as Hal Holbrook's Mark Twain or James Whitmore's Harry Truman) makes this a DVD worth watching by anyone who appreciates a magnificent performance from an incredible actor and one that should definitely be in every Christian's collection.
summary: Magnificent performance from an incredible actor,

reviewText: As far as one-man performances on stage go, this one will amaze and enthrall you.  Dean Jones takes on the one-man role of St. John, exiled on the isle of Patmos at the age of 84.Reminiscing about Jesus' life and teachings while sitting in a cave, Jones' St. John uses voice inflection and facial expressions masterfully as he describes the wonder of Jesus' miracles, the agony of his Crucifixion, and the personal fear and trepidation of the disciples forced into hiding after Jesus' death in order to survive.  A committed Christian and dedicated actor, Dean Jones' portrayal of St. John will stick in your mind far longer than the Disney films done by him in the 1960's and 1970's.  This one shows a more complete picture of Dean Jones' personal range as an actor, which has probably greatly increased since this production was done in 1988.  Despite its age, the message of the performance is powerful, timeless, and thought-provoking.Lastly,the performance does not carry any type of offensive language and may be enjoyed by viewers of all ages.
Title: N/A
